abstract: <jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:p>Leveraging genome-wide association statistics generated from a large study of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS; 29,612 cases and 122,656 controls) and UK Biobank (UKB; 4,024 phenotypes, up to 361,194 participants), we conducted a phenome-wide analysis of ALS genetic liability and identified 46 genetically correlated traits, such as fluid intelligence score (<jats:italic>r</jats:italic><jats:sub><jats:italic>g</jats:italic></jats:sub> = − 0.21, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 1.74 × 10<jats:sup>–6</jats:sup>), "spending time in pub or social club” (<jats:italic>r</jats:italic><jats:sub><jats:italic>g</jats:italic></jats:sub> = 0.24, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 2.77 × 10<jats:sup>–6</jats:sup>), non-work related walking (<jats:italic>r</jats:italic><jats:sub><jats:italic>g</jats:italic></jats:sub> = − 0.25, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 1.95 × 10<jats:sup>–6</jats:sup>), college education (<jats:italic>r</jats:italic><jats:sub><jats:italic>g</jats:italic></jats:sub> = − 0.15, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 7.08 × 10<jats:sup>–5</jats:sup>), “ever diagnosed with panic attacks (<jats:italic>r</jats:italic><jats:sub><jats:italic>g</jats:italic></jats:sub> = 0.39, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 4.24 × 10<jats:sup>–5</jats:sup>), and “self-reported other gastritis including duodenitis” (<jats:italic>r</jats:italic><jats:sub><jats:italic>g</jats:italic></jats:sub> = 0.28, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 1.4 × 10<jats:sup>–3</jats:sup>). To assess the putative directionality of these genetic correlations, we conducted a latent causal variable analysis, identifying significant genetic causality proportions (gĉp) linking ALS genetic liability to seven traits. While the genetic component of “self-reported other gastritis including duodenitis" showed a causal effect on ALS (gĉp = 0.50, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 1.26 × 10<jats:sup>–29</jats:sup>), the genetic liability to ALS is potentially causal for multiple traits, also including an effect on "ever being diagnosed with panic attacks” (gĉp = 0.79, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 5.011 × 10<jats:sup>–15</jats:sup>) and inverse effects on “other leisure/social group activities” (gĉp = 0.66, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 1 × 10<jats:sup>–4</jats:sup>) and prospective memory result (gĉp = 0.35, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 0.005). Our subsequent Mendelian randomization analysis indicated that some of these associations may be due to bidirectional effects. In conclusion, this phenome-wide investigation of ALS polygenic architecture highlights the widespread pleiotropy linking this disorder with several health domains.</jats:p>
